parameters: \nr<Warrior>Tch.
\n<Adventurer>I managed to make some helpful equipment using the
whatever falls off those titanic faeries' bodies.
\n<Adventurer>This is the only building in this model that
has some furniture because the faeries shrunk some toy
beds for us to sleep in.
\n<Adventurer>Are they making fun of us? We're even smaller
than the furniture. We have to climb up to these beds
just to get some rest.
\n<Adventurer>Doesn't look like even with the Guild Master's help
that we're going to be getting any new furniture any
time soon.
\n<Adventurer>I get that it's hard to make small things, but
couldn't those faeries just shrink some beds to our
scale too?
SpriteZoom.zoom(21, 0.6);
SpriteZoom.zoom(22, 0.6);
SpriteZoom.zoom(23, 0.6);
SpriteZoom.zoom(53, 20);
\nr<Warrior>There's a large tower in the other town model.
\c[2]The mechanism is at the top of the tower, but
getting up there requires solving the tower's
navigation puzzle.\c[0]
\nr<Warrior>Hey, new blood. I guess we're not the newbies in
this town anymore.
\n<Assassin>Hm? Wait, aren't you the punk who kicked us out
of the our shelter before?
\n<Assassin>Heh. Serves you right to get shrunken down and
trapped just like us.
AlainFace
\n<Alain>Oh. You're the two idiots I've met before!
(I didn't realize until now, but they're
also the ones who tried to mess with Gale
when she just started adventuring.)
\n<Assassin>Idiots? Why does everyone in this town keep calling
us that? We didn't do much.
AlainFace
\n<Alain>Weren't you trying to pick up cute
adventurers and recruit them to your party?
I think there was even a request to get
you to leave before.
\nr<Warrior>Ah. Was that the time that pretty dragon girl
spoke to us? It was after that swordswoman kicked me
in the face for complementing her body, if I recall.
\n<Assassin>Listen, I follow along with him since he's a good
leader. Don't lump me in with him...
AlainFace
\n<Alain>Okay, so one idiot and his tagalong
friend. I'll make note of that for the
future.
AlainFace
\n<Alain>In any case. Those faeries sure are crazy.
I can't believe the lack of adventurers was
because they've been shrinking people.
\n<Assassin>They've been propositioning adventurers who were
hoping to get a look at a faerie village. If we said
yes, they used the Faeries' Blessing on us right then
and there.
\nr<Warrior>I couldn't refuse such a cutie of a faerie. I
wish they would've gotten some female adventurers in
this town too, but I guess they either refused or the
faeries never approached them.
AlainFace
\n<Alain>Well, thankfully the guild finally took
notice. That's why I came here.
AlainFace
\n<Alain>I have allies that'll help, but I need
to buy time for them. If I keep those
faeries entertained and distracted, that
should be good enough.
\n<Assassin>Seriously? You're part of the rescue operation?
Then we'll help out however we can. What do you need?
AlainFace
\n<Alain>Those faeries said I have to open the
gates for them to be willing to listen to
me. Any ideas on how to do that?
\n<Assassin>Open those gates? If I knew, I'd run out into
the carpet and hide until Faeries' Blessing wore off.
\nr<Warrior>I think I can help you there. I've been taking a
good look around town and the puzzle's easy to figure
understand.
AlainFace
\n<Alain>You know? Then please tell me.
\n<Assassin>See? I told you he was leader material.
\nr<Warrior>What do you guys take me for? I haven't just
been staring up at faerie boobs and legs, you know? I
just haven't tried putting this into action because I
know I can't handle those giant faeries.
\nr<Warrior>We're currently in two model sets that are glued
together. Niim Town's model is easy. There are four
colored switches in the empty buildings.
\nr<Warrior>All you have to do is \c[2]hit the switches
in the correct sequence.\c[0]
AlainFace
\n<Alain>And the order is?
\nr<Warrior>\c[2]The color sequence should be very obvious
if you look at the town walls. \c[0]
\nr<Warrior>As for the other town... It's a strange
place. I've never seen buildings like that before. I
guess models towns can be original if the artist is
creative enough.
\nr<Warrior>There's a large tower in the other town model.
\c[2]The mechanism is at the top of the tower, but
getting up there requires solving the tower's
navigation puzzle.\c[0]
AlainFace
\n<Alain>Well, you just promoted yourself from
idiot to genius. I think I underestimated
you.
AlainFace
\n<Alain>So press the buttons in order
and climb the tower? Alright. I'll give it
a shot.
\nr<Warrior>Well, if it isn't our savior! Thanks a million
for getting the Guild Master to teach those faeries
a lesson!
\n<Assassin>Yeah. We're making due now that those faeries
have to keep using their magic to help us change back.
\n<Assassin>It'll take a while, but as long as we make
it through this, we'll be back to normal.
AlainFace
\n<Alain>That's good to hear, you two. Those
faeries aren't slacking off and deciding to
play around with you again, are they?
\n<Assassin>Ah... Well... Some of the time. But it's usually
to the guys who just ask...
\nr<Warrior>What? It's not bad getting to wander around a
pretty girl's legs at this size. And besides, it lets
those faeries have some stress relief too so that
they don't get tired of this.
AlainFace
\n<Alain>You know, he has a point. Keeping those
faeries appeased will work out better in
the long run.
AlainFace
\n<Alain>I'm... not going to question your
fetishes...
\nr<Warrior>Hehe. My good man, since you're here, why don't
you help us even more? Unlike you, we're stuck here
waiting idly.
AlainFace
\n<Alain>So you need help? I don't really mind.
What's the problem?
\nr<Warrior>You see... A few of us have some business that
needs to be taken careful that we can't do while we're
here.
\nr<Warrior>I compiled a list of everyone's problems, and since
you're capable, if you could take some of our requests,
we'd very much appreciate it.
\nr<Warrior>Sadly, we don't really have much to offer
as payment other than teaching you our own skills. I
hope that's alright.
AlainFace
\n<Alain>If it's in my power to do so - sure. I
could use a few skill tomes. Maybe I could
teach my other party members too.
\nr<Warrior>Ah, if you were a pretty lady, I could just
kiss you right now in gratitude!
\nr<Warrior>Just take a look at the list right here and
do whatever you can.
\nr<Warrior>I'll warn you, though. Some of these guys have
pretty dangerous request.
\nr<Warrior>Well, if it isn't our savior! Would you mind
introducing me to that pretty giant succubus you
brought along?
\n<Assassin>All you have to do is \c[2]hit the switches
in the correct sequence.\c[0]
\n<Assassin>\c[2]The color sequence should be very obvious
if you look at the town walls. \c[0]

\n<Assassin>This guy doesn't really discriminate as long as
the other person's pretty. I'm more of a single
target kidn of man. And I'm more interested in cats
than faeries, dragons, and demons.
\n<Assassin>... Oh. I'm not referring to anyone in particular!
Look at the Micro Quest Listings?
Yes
No
Yes
There is a quest from the micro assassin at the toy
guild's front desk.
'This is embarrassing to admit, but I need some help
regarding Miss Iora, the Guild Shop Clerk. Come
talk to me over at the West end of the Tiny Ancient
Ruins. I won't say this in front of anyone else.'
'If you help me, I'll teach give you a skill tome for
the support skill - Reflection Seal.'
Accept this quest?
Yes
Check for other quests
Yes
Quest Add 31
Report to the Assassin who will only speak of this at
the Toy Ancient Ruins.
Check for other quests
There is a quest from the smart micro adventurer in the
Toy Building.
'These toy ruins are more than they seem. I was able
to construct a golem with the materials available, but
it's been going haywire ever since the Guild Master
came.'
'Please help me contain this golem. I will offer my
strongest earth magic skill as a reward.'
Accept this quest?
Yes
Check for other quests
Yes
Quest Add 30
Report to the Micro adventurer in the Toy Building at
the Toy Ancient Ruins.
Check for other quests
There don't seem to be any other Micro Quests at
the moment.
A Micro Quest has already been accepted.
No
